title: Swiftcart
description: Full-stack web application that lets users create shopping lists, compare prices across multiple stores, and optimize grocery budgets.
experiences: Designed and implemented the majority of the React frontend with focus on usability, responsive design, and clear user journeys.
Collaborated on backend integration with Node.js and MongoDB to build scalable, data-driven features.
Owned features from idea to delivery within a SCRUM process, ensuring continuous feedback and iteration.

title: Web Architecture and Orchestration (Course Project)
description: Course project to develop a scalable backend system based on microservice architecture with an emphasis on orchestration and service communication.
experiences: Developed a scalable backend system based on microservice architecture.
Implemented service-to-service communication using REST and gRPC.
Orchestrated containerized services with Kubernetes and focused on scalability, observability, and fault tolerance.

title: Machine Learning (SWMAL-01) (Course Project)
description: 5 ECTS course project focused on machine learning theory and practical pipelines in Python.
experiences: Worked with ML pipelines: data preparation, model selection, and evaluation.
Applied algorithms including regression, neural networks, and dimensionality reduction.
Implemented and compared models using Python ML frameworks and improved performance through preprocessing and evaluation.

title: Advanced Front-End Development (Course Project)
description: Training application focusing on modern front-end technologies (Angular and Next.js) with emphasis on SSR, PWA, and responsive single-page applications.
experiences: Developed web applications using Angular and Next.js.
Worked with server-side rendering (SSR) and Progressive Web App (PWA) features.
Designed and implemented responsive layouts and component-based architectures.

title: Recipe Web Application (Personal Project)
description: Web application for storing household recipes, adding and viewing recipes, and planning weekly meals. Planned future features include recipe import and automatic shopping list generation.
experiences: Strengthened skills in web application design and feature planning.
Turned user needs into practical, scalable solutions through iterative development.
Explored extensions and feature planning to keep the project maintainable and extensible.
